intro: Thomasia rhynchocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit thomasia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Thomasia rhynchocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
